channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overflowing bins from 163 in Copers Cope Road., 7th August
item.description:
This overflowing bins have been left on front of the house for over a months and they never get empty. Neighbours don’t seems to put them on the street on collection day. Bins are now smelling bad, full of flys and the litter is also coming to our front door. We’re concerned about the hygiene state of this situation and the possibility that they can attract foxes or rats. Thank you for your help
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Copers Cope Road, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish, 7th August
item.description:
2 bags been taken out of car hav got reg left behind car after owner came back from being at work as they ALL use lensbury way as a parking area can see driver at back of car then driving off and then bags are there and yes hav check on bags NOT being there before he backs into parking spot now as you can see the foxes hav ripped them open and spread it ALL over the place please STOP these people from parking here so they can dump there rubbish after they finish work

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lensbury Way, Lessness Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish not collect in days, 6th August
item.description:
Directly outside the nature garden south Council employees have been emptying the bin leaving the full bags tied at the side of the street but these have not been collected for over a week so have become ripped from animals looking for food and there are rats and mice coming and going

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bantry Street, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet
